pullRequest.title: Phenotype Enum Standardization and Fully Implementing Vehicle, ProtoMech, and Naval Phenotypes
pullRequest.bodyText:
This moves Phenotypes into a single enum instead of two divergent sets of Magic Numbers, and finishes the implementation of Naval, Vehicle, and ProtoMech phenotype tracking.
To review: Whitespace differences off, and I'd go through the files with few changes first then the files with more changes.

commit.message: Continuing to implement bloodname and phenotype changes
Finishing implementing Phenotype and Bloodname changes
Fixing selected faction not working properly

nodes.bodyText: Let's leave this here. It is extremely useful for debugging, or if you want to generate some specific units.
nodes.diffHunk:

         return en;
     }
 
-    /**
-     * Generates a new Entity without using a RAT. Useful for "persistent" or fixed units.
-     *

-     * @param fName            Faction code to use for crew name generation
-     * @param skill            RandomSkillsGenerator.L_* constant for the average force skill level.
-     * @param campaign
-     * @return                A new Entity
-     */

-    private static Entity getEntityByName(String name, String fName, int skill, Campaign campaign) {

nodes.bodyText: Let's go through this file and put some documentation on the methods.
At the very least the public ones.
I wonder if anyone actually has saves from before 3.4. I would suggest moving this out into a separate method.
Forgot to add to this: Should there be bonuses here for the other phenotypes?

commit.message: Readding and reworking getEntityByName as per review
